availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Woodruff (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky clerk and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Ella T. Connelly in 1865. Clerk in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as an adjutant and captain from December 31, 1861 to January 12, 1865. Resident of Knoxville, Knox County, Tennessee, in 1865. Owned Woodruff Hardware in Knoxville from 1865 to 1926.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 704.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0269.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 861-2.
"Final Rites for Capt. Woodruff" The Knoxville Journal (Knoxville, Tennessee), February 1, 1926, p. 5.
